org.getspout.spoutapi.chunkdatamanager
Interface ChunkDataManager

All Known Implementing Classes:
SimpleChunkDataManager
public interface ChunkDataManager

Method Summary
 Serializable getBlockData(String id, org.bukkit.World world, int x, int y, int z)
          Returns the block data for the block at (x, y, z) and a given id.
 Serializable getChunkData(String id, org.bukkit.World world, int x, int z)
          Returns the chunk data for the chunk at (x, z) and a given id.
 short[] getCustomBlockIds(org.bukkit.World world, int x, int z)
          Gets the custom block ids that are used for the chunk at (x, z) Modifying this array will change the contents of this chunk.
 int getStringId(String string)
          Creates/retrieves a unique id corresponding to this string This id does not persist over server restarts or reloads
 Serializable removeBlockData(String id, org.bukkit.World world, int x, int y, int z)
          Removes and returns the block data for the block at (x, y, z) and a given id.
 Serializable removeChunkData(String id, org.bukkit.World world, int x, int z)
          Removes and returns the chunk data for the chunk at (x, z) and a given id.
 Serializable setBlockData(String id, org.bukkit.World world, int x, int y, int z, Serializable data)
          Sets block data for the block at (x, y, z) and a given id.
 Serializable setChunkData(String id, org.bukkit.World world, int x, int z, Serializable data)
          Sets chunk data for the chunk at (x, z) and a given id.
 void setCustomBlockIds(org.bukkit.World world, int x, int z, short[] ids)
          Sets the custom block ids that are used for the chunk at (x, z) Modifying this array will override the contents of this chunk.
 

Method Detail

getStringId

int getStringId(String string)
Creates/retrieves a unique id corresponding to this string This id does not persist over server restarts or reloads

Parameters:
string - the String to get the id for
Returns:
the id associated with this string

setBlockData

Serializable setBlockData(String id,
                          org.bukkit.World world,
                          int x,
                          int y,
                          int z,
                          Serializable data)
Sets block data for the block at (x, y, z) and a given id. Setting data for unloaded chunks has an undefined effect.

Parameters:
id - the id used to retrieve the data
x - the X block coordinate
y - the Y block coordinate
z - the Z block coordinate
data - the data to be stored
Returns:
the old data for that block using that string

getBlockData

Serializable getBlockData(String id,
                          org.bukkit.World world,
                          int x,
                          int y,
                          int z)
Returns the block data for the block at (x, y, z) and a given id. Retrieving data for unloaded chunks is undefined.

Parameters:
id - the id used to retrieve the data
x - the X block coordinate
y - the Y block coordinate
z - the Z block coordinate
Returns:
the old data for that block using that string

removeBlockData

Serializable removeBlockData(String id,
                             org.bukkit.World world,
                             int x,
                             int y,
                             int z)
Removes and returns the block data for the block at (x, y, z) and a given id. Deleting data for unloaded chunks has an undefined effect.

Parameters:
id - the id used to retrieve the data
x - the X block coordinate
y - the Y block coordinate
z - the Z block coordinate
Returns:
the old data for that block using that string

                          org.bukkit.World world,
                          int x,
                          int z,
                          Serializable data)
Sets chunk data for the chunk at (x, z) and a given id. Setting data for unloaded chunks has an undefined effect.

Parameters:
id - the id used to retrieve the data
world - the world
x - the X chunk coordinate
z - the Z chunk coordinate
data - the data to be stored
Returns:
the old data for that block using that string

getCustomBlockIds

short[] getCustomBlockIds(org.bukkit.World world,
                          int x,
                          int z)
Gets the custom block ids that are used for the chunk at (x, z) Modifying this array will change the contents of this chunk.

Parameters:
world - the world
x - the X chunk coordinate
z - the Z chunk coordinate
Returns:
custom block ids

setCustomBlockIds

void setCustomBlockIds(org.bukkit.World world,
                       int x,
                       int z,
                       short[] ids)
Sets the custom block ids that are used for the chunk at (x, z) Modifying this array will override the contents of this chunk.

Parameters:
world - the world
x - the X chunk coordinate
z - the Z chunk coordinate
ids - the custom block ids
